segment.source: How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer
segment.target: How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer

segment.source: How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer
segment.target: How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer

segment.source: How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer
segment.target: How to Run the Crash Analyzer on an End-user Computer

segment.source: To run Crash Analyzer from the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window on an end-user computer that is experiencing problems, you must have the Microsoft Debugging Tools for Windows and the symbol files installed.
segment.target: To run Crash Analyzer from the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window on an end-user computer that is experiencing problems, you must have the Microsoft Debugging Tools for Windows and the symbol files installed.

segment.source: To download the Windows Debugging Tools, see Debugging Tools for Windows.
segment.target: To download the Windows Debugging Tools, see Debugging Tools for Windows.

segment.source: To run the Crash Analyzer on an end-user computer
segment.target: To run the Crash Analyzer on an end-user computer

segment.source: On the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window on an end-user computer, click Crash Analyzer.
segment.target: On the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window on an end-user computer, click Crash Analyzer.

segment.source: Provide the required information for the Microsoft Debugging Tools for Windows.
segment.target: Provide the required information for the Microsoft Debugging Tools for Windows.

segment.source: Provide the required information for the symbol files.
segment.target: Provide the required information for the symbol files.

segment.source: For more information about symbol files, see How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files.
segment.target: For more information about symbol files, see How to Ensure that Crash Analyzer Can Access Symbol Files.

segment.source: Provide the required information for a memory dump file.
segment.target: Provide the required information for a memory dump file.

segment.source: To determine the location of the memory dump file:
segment.target: To determine the location of the memory dump file:

segment.source: Open the System Properties window.
segment.target: Open the System Properties window.

segment.source: Click Start, type sysdm.cpl, and then press Enter.
segment.target: Click Start, type sysdm.cpl, and then press Enter.

segment.source: Click the Advanced tab.
segment.target: Click the Advanced tab.

segment.source: In the Startup and Recovery area, click Settings.
segment.target: In the Startup and Recovery area, click Settings.

segment.source: If you do not have access to the System Properties window, you can search for dump files on the end-user computer by using the Search tool in Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10.
segment.target: If you do not have access to the System Properties window, you can search for dump files on the end-user computer by using the Search tool in Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 10.

segment.source: The Crash Analyzer scans the memory dump file and reports a probable cause of the problem.
segment.target: The Crash Analyzer scans the memory dump file and reports a probable cause of the problem.

segment.source: You can view more information about the failure, such as the specific memory dump message and description, the drivers loaded at the time of the failure, and the full output of the analysis.
segment.target: You can view more information about the failure, such as the specific memory dump message and description, the drivers loaded at the time of the failure, and the full output of the analysis.

segment.source: Identify the appropriate strategy to resolve the problem.
segment.target: Identify the appropriate strategy to resolve the problem.

segment.source: The strategy may require disabling or updating the device driver that caused the failure by using the Services and Drivers node of the Computer Management tool in DaRT 10.
segment.target: The strategy may require disabling or updating the device driver that caused the failure by using the Services and Drivers node of the Computer Management tool in DaRT 10.
